comments:
I'm not sure if this is a harmless side effect of the fix for bug 81528 or an
indication of an incomplete fix. 

Will need to be investigated before M5.

Phil ... since this one, at least, appears related to search ... thought I'd CC
you in case you notice anything funny in the stack trace.

I could also see this in my Linux dev. env. 
I think in that case related to a space in the project name. 
That's using j2sdk1.4.2_07, if that matters.

It's definitely the new code for bug 81528, but that code only runs if the
EMF-derived URI class itself throws an IllegalArgumentException.  That first
exception is swallowed and the java.net.URI class tried instead.  If *that* one
throws an exception, then it is logged.

So ... based on Nitin's investigation, I'm lowering priority to P2. 
I think we are now only being told about problems whereas before they 
were silently ignored. That is .... there are still problems, but it is 
not a new bug or regression. In particular, the case I saw with space the 
project name we should be able to handle (I know the base Eclipse platform
handles it fine, and transarently to clients).  I'm less sure about the
${workspace} case. I have no idea what that is about, or if ${} is normally
"legal" (is obviously meant to be "filled in" before resolving but not sure who
is supposed to be doing that). I do know the Eclipse platform uses things like
$nl$ to be "pre-resolved" to the nl system setting. See bug 102042 for example. 

We need to honor those types of conventions as well. 

We need tons of unit tests for URI resolution.
And ... I think ... now more correctly belongs to Craig for further comment/action?

There's not enough information here to make sense of what's going wrong here. 
What are the UI steps required to reproduce?  I think I'll need to set some
breakpoints and check some parameter values in order to figure this out.
David, is this issue still current? Seems quite old and perhaps became irrelevant or was fixed indirectly? If still relevant, can you please provide some steps to reproduce the problem. Thanks.

No, no longer an issue. 

I do not see this in our test logs on the build machine.
